content.description:
This route goes up the smooth slopping wall just to the left of Waterfall Crack (route 24 (5.7) in Swartling's guide). It starts by standing up on the small ledge and using under-clings to get to a rail. Then using a couple bad slopers and a heel hook go big for another bad sloper above the bulge. Then proceed up to the massive ledge. Once on the ledge mantel up and over the middle of the roof without using any of the side walls. 

  GOOD LUCK!!!

Start up the right diagonal ledge then climb up crack to ledge then up through the notch in the overhang. 

  Good for learning how to effectively use a hand jam and a mantel.
Climb the inside corner and chimney in middle of Waterfall wall.  Ok route, but it was just horribly dirty and seems like the main water runoff for the cliff.
content.protection: Small wires to larger fist sized cams and hexes.
content.location: Middle of wall, left of Disappearing Ledges.

content.description: Climb middle of overhanging wall with lots of good features.  Short but pumpy.  Listed as a 5.12a in guide book, but it feels much easier.
content.location: Hike to the right of wall around the corner, this route is the middle of steep face.

content.description: Start on the low angle rock to the right of Waterfall Chimney. Make your way up and around the the corner to the right and then to a ledge. Continue climbing up and to the left small overhanging corner and top out.
content.location: Start on the slab to the right of Waterfall Chimney.

content.description: Hard start. Climb the crack system going left or right at the top corner.
content.location: Right side of Waterfall Wall next to "Slimer". Start between the two blocks and ascend the cracks goin left or right at the upper corner.

content.description: The Waterfall Wall is a small cliff above the north side of the Railroad Amphitheater.
